qas.question: When was Glasgow's police force established?
When was Ireland's police force established?
What was Ireland's police force called?
When was Glasgow's police force abolished?
When was Ireland's police force abolished?
What was Ireland's police force not called?

context: Meanwhile, the authorities in Glasgow, Scotland successfully petitioned the government to pass the <a0_0><b5_0>Glasgow Police Act<b5_0/><a0_0/> establishing the City of Glasgow Police in <a1_0><b6_0>1800<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Other Scottish towns soon followed suit and set up their own police forces through acts of parliament. In Ireland, the <a2_0><b7_0>Irish Constabulary Act<a2_0/> of <a3_0><b8_0>1822<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> marked the beginning of the <a4_0><b9_0>Royal Irish Constabulary<b9_0/><a4_0/>. The Act established a force in each barony with chief constables and inspectors general under the control of the civil administration at Dublin Castle. By 1841 this force numbered over 8,600 men.
